page.syntax: V append_arrays(P array1 , C filter1,[,P array2,C filter2,[,P arrayN,C filter3]])
page.description: Appends array(s) values to current array, but first applies a filter.
page.original:
&ltARRAY>.APPEND_ARRAYS_FILTERED() Syntax New_Array as P = &ltARRAY>.APPEND_ARRAYS_FILTERED( Array1 as P, Filter1 as C, Array2 as P, Filter2 as C ) ArgumentDescription New_ArrayThe new array produced by appending Array2 to Array1. Array1The first array. Filter1A character filter expression that selects elements from Array1. Array2The second array. Filter2A character filter expression that selects elements from Array2.
Description The &ltARRAY>.APPEND_ARRAYS_FILTERED() method selects elements from Array2 and Array1 and merges them to produce New_Array. Both Array1 and Array2 must have a single dimension and have the same structure. Example dim cars[10] as P cars.initialize_properties("manufacturer|model",&lt Ford|Taurus Ford|Focus GM|Malibu Dodge|Status %str%) dim trucks[10] as P trucks.initialize_properties("manufacturer|model",&lt Ford|F-150 Ford|Ranger Dodge|Dakota %str%) dim vehicles[2] as P vehicles.append_arrays_filtered(cars,"manufacturer='Ford'",trucks,"manufacturer='Ford'") values = vehicles.dump_properties("manufacturer model") ui_dlg_box("show_array",&lt [.50,10index^||values] %dlg%)
